trans-unit.source: The exception that occurs when the print job does not run correctly.
Classes within the <xref:System.Printing> namespace are not supported for use within a Windows service or ASP.NET application or service.
Attempting to use these classes from within one of these application types may produce unexpected problems, such as diminished service performance and run-time exceptions.
If you want to print from a Windows Forms application, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific error condition.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code and error condition.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides specific <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext"></xref>.
This constructor is protected.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific error condition, including the cause of the exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.
The underlying error that caused the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code and error condition, including the underlying cause of the exception.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.
The underlying error that caused the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific error code, error condition, print queue name, job name, and job ID.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.
The name of the print queue hosting the print job that caused the exception.
The name of the print job that caused the exception.
The ID number of the print job that caused the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintJobException"></xref> class that provides a specific message, error code, error condition, print queue name, job name, and job ID.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that is interpreted as an HRESULT, a coded numerical value that is assigned to a specific exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that describes the error condition.
The name of the print queue hosting the print job that caused the exception.
The name of the print job that caused the exception.
The ID number of the print job that caused the exception.
The underlying cause of the exception.
Gets the data that is used to serialize the object and gets the context of the serialized stream.
The data that is required to serialize or deserialize an object.
The context, including source and destination, of the serialized stream.
Gets the ID number of the print job that caused the exception.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> that identifies the print job.
Gets the name of the print job that caused the exception.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that names the print job.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref> that was hosting the print job when the exception was thrown.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that specifies the name of the <xref href="System.Printing.PrintQueue"></xref>.
